wikipedia_page.main: Leslie "Les" Stuart Fairclough (30 September 1902 – 7 October 1951) was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1920s and 1930s. He played at representative level for Great Britain, England and Lancashire, and at club level for St. Helens, as a centre, stand-off, or scrum-half, i.e. number 3 or 4, 6, or 7.

response: *Les Fairclough (1902–1951), English professional rugby league player
